articles.headline: New Top Editor at Washington Post: Marcus Brauchli to Be Replaced by Martin Baron
articles.snippet: Marcus Brauchli, hired in 2008 after working at The Wall Street Journal, is stepping down as top editor as The Post continues to grapple with the challenges of a difficult business environment for newspapers.
articles.abstract: Marcus Brauchli, hired in 2008 after working at The Wall Street Journal, is stepping down as top editor as The Post continues to grapple with the challenges of a difficult business environment for newspapers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated 11/14/12In Washington, where there are few closely kept secrets, it has been widely known for months that Katharine Weymouth, the publisher of The Washington Post, wanted to replace the paper’s executive editor, Marcus Brauchli.

articles.headline: Online Privacy Issue Is Also in Play in Petraeus Scandal
articles.snippet: The F.B.I. investigation that toppled David H. Petraeus, the director of the C.I.A., underscores a danger that civil libertarians have long warned about.
articles.abstract: The F.B.I. investigation that toppled David H. Petraeus, the director of the C.I.A., underscores a danger that civil libertarians have long warned about.
articles.lead_paragraph: The F.B.I. investigation that toppled the director of the C.I.A. and  has now entangled the top American commander in Afghanistan underscores a danger that civil libertarians have long warned about: that in policing the Web for crime, espionage and sabotage, government investigators will unavoidably invade the private lives of Americans.

articles.headline: Money Fund Reform Has Top Support
articles.snippet: Financial regulators are pushing for stronger rules for money market mutual funds.
articles.abstract: Financial regulators are pushing for stronger rules for money market mutual funds.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A council of top financial regulators, upset with the Securities and Exchange Commission for failing to strengthen rules governing money market mutual funds since the financial crisis, is trying to force the S.E.C. to adopt stricter regulations.

articles.headline: Lessons From Another Storm
articles.snippet: Disaster-proofing your finances is an important step to prepare for the possibility that a disaster like Hurricane Sandy or the tornado in Joplin, Mo., will affect you.
articles.abstract: Disaster-proofing your finances is an important step to prepare for the possibility that a disaster like Hurricane Sandy or the tornado in Joplin, Mo., will affect you.

articles.headline: Fuel From Waste, Poised at a Milestone
articles.snippet: Large-scale commercial production would be a major renewable energy milestone, and plants in Florida and Mississippi say they are near that point.
articles.abstract: Large-scale commercial production would be a major renewable energy milestone, and plants in Florida and Mississippi say they are near that point.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For years, scientists and engineers have been juggling various combinations of acids, steam, bacteria, catalysts and the digestive juices of microorganisms to convert agricultural waste and even household garbage into motor fuel.

articles.headline: Charity’s Role in America, and Its Limits
articles.snippet: The support for victims of Hurricane Sandy highlights how charity plays in our social contract — we Americans view ourselves as generous, yet we mistrust the government to help those in need.
articles.abstract: The support for victims of Hurricane Sandy highlights how charity plays in our social contract — we Americans view ourselves as generous, yet we mistrust the government to help those in need.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anyone doubting Americans’ charity should visit the Rockaways in Queens. Volunteers from all over the city and beyond have descended upon the devastated communities, providing cash, supplies and assistance to locals marooned in waterlogged homes without food or power. They are helping to fill a void in the government’s sometimes plodding response to the disaster wrought by Hurricane Sandy.

articles.headline: On the New Shopping List: Milk, Bread, Eggs and a Mortgage
articles.snippet: As big banks keep credit tight and more people have no bank at all, retailers like Costco, Home Depot and Walmart are offering financial products like prepaid cards, loans and even life insurance.
articles.abstract: As big banks keep credit tight and more people have no bank at all, retailers like Costco, Home Depot and Walmart are offering financial products like prepaid cards, loans and even life insurance.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lilly Neubauer shops Costco for paper towels, lentils and carrots — and now, even a home mortgage.
articles.byline: By Stephanie Clifford and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

articles.headline: Tampa Is Seen as Social Link for Unfolding Scandal
articles.snippet: At the heart of an investigation around David H. Petraeus is Jill Kelley, who was a kind of social liaison between the military and civilian elite.
articles.abstract: At the heart of an investigation around David H. Petraeus is Jill Kelley, who was a kind of social liaison between the military and civilian elite.
articles.lead_paragraph: TAMPA, Fla. — Jill and Scott Kelley moved here about a decade ago, taking up residence in a huge redbrick home with a spectacular view of the water on Bayshore Boulevard, the city’s most fashionable street. They quickly established themselves as social hosts to the powerful four-star officers who run two of the nation’s most important military commands.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt and Sheryl Gay Stolberg

articles.headline: Ex-Windows Chief Seen as Smart but Abrasive
articles.snippet: An accumulation of run-ins with other company leaders led to Steven Sinofsky’s departure, according to several current and former Microsoft executives.
articles.abstract: An accumulation of run-ins with other company leaders led to Steven Sinofsky’s departure, according to several current and former Microsoft executives.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a warm night in late October, Steven Sinofsky stood on a platform in New York’s Times Square, smiling as a huge crowd roared at the unveiling of a Microsoft retail store, where Windows 8 and the company’s new Surface tablet were about to go on sale.

articles.headline: Ferocious Israeli Assault on Gaza Kills a Leader of Hamas
articles.snippet: Israel hit at least 20 targets in aerial attacks that killed the military commander of Hamas, damaged Israel’s fragile relations with Egypt and escalated the risks of a new war in the Middle East.
articles.abstract: Israel hit at least 20 targets in aerial attacks that killed the military commander of Hamas, damaged Israel’s fragile relations with Egypt and escalated the risks of a new war in the Middle East.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Israel on Wednesday launched the most ferocious assault on Gaza in four years after persistent Palestinian rocket fire, hitting at least 20 targets in aerial attacks that killed the top military commander of Hamas, damaged Israel’s fragile relations with Egypt and escalated the risks of a new war in the Middle East.
articles.byline: By Isabel Kershner and Fares Akram
